featured.text: Before Moran arrived, Yellowstone in the popular imagination was a harsh, wild place with hot water and steam coming out of hellish holes in the ground.
Few of them understood that on their way they would have to cross a harsh wilderness.

definition.en_def: Unpleasantly rough or jarring to the senses; severe or cruel.
definition.example: The harsh winter made it difficult for many animals to survive.
